Statement: What is the number of subsets of a set with 5 elements? a) 5 b) 10 c) 25 d) 32
Which of the following is a valid implication in propositional logic? a) ( p → (q ^ r) ) b) ( p ^ (q → r) ) c) ( p → q ^ r ) d) ( p ^ q → r )
In a directed graph, if every vertex has the same in-degree and out-degree, the graph is called: a) Eulerian b) Hamiltonian c) Regular d) Bipartite
The principle of mathematical induction is used to prove: a) Theorems involving natural numbers b) Theorems involving real numbers c) Theorems involving complex numbers d) Theorems involving matrices
Which of the following is a bijective function? a) 𝑓: 𝑁 → 𝑁 defined by 𝑓( 𝑛 ) = 𝑛 + 1 b) 𝑓: 𝑅 → 𝑅 defined by 𝑓( 𝑥 ) = 𝑥2 c) 𝑓: 𝑍 → 𝑍 defined by 𝑓( 𝑛 ) = 2𝑛 d) 𝑓: 𝑅 → 𝑅 defined by 𝑓( 𝑥 ) = 𝑥 + 1
In a lattice, the meet and join operations correspond to: a) Addition and subtraction b) Multiplication and division c) Minimum and maximum d) Union and intersection
The number of edges in a complete bipartite graph K_{3,4} is: a) 7 b) 12 c) 11 d) 10
Which of the following sets is **not** closed under the operation of addition? a) Natural numbers b) Integers c) Rational numbers d) Irrational numbers

In graph theory, a complete graph is a graph in which: a) There is a path between any two nodes b) Every node has the same number of edges c) Every pair of nodes is connected by a unique edge d) There are no cycles

The chromatic number of a graph is defined as: a) The minimum number of colors needed to color the graph such that no two adjacent vertices share the same color b) The maximum number of colors needed to color the graph c) The sum of the degrees of all vertices d) The total number of edges in the graph
Which of the following propositions is a tautology? a) P ∧ ¬P b) P ∨ ¬P c) P → P d) ¬P → P
In set theory, the power set of a set A is: a) The set of all subsets of A b) The set of all elements of A c) The set of all ordered pairs of A d) The set of all ordered pairs of the elements in A
Which of the following is an example of a bijective function? a) f(x) = x² from R to R b) f(x) = eˣ from R to R⁺ c) f(x) = sin(x) from R to [-1, 1] d) f(x) = 2x + 3 from R to R
The number of elements in the Cartesian product of sets A and B, where |A| = 3 and |B| = 4, is: a) 7 b) 12 c) 1 d) 0
Which of the following is true for an Eulerian graph? a) All vertices have even degree b) All vertices have odd degree c) The graph is complete d) The graph has exactly two vertices of odd degree
In propositional logic, the contrapositive of the implication P → Q is: a) ¬P → ¬Q b) Q → P c) ¬Q → ¬P d) P ↔ Q

The principle of inclusion-exclusion is used to calculate: a) The intersection of sets b) The union of sets c) The number of elements in the complement of a set d) The number of elements in the union of sets considering overlaps

If a relation \(R\) on a set \(A\) is transitive, which of the following must be true? a) If \(aRb\) and \(bRc\), then \(aRc\) b) If \(aRb\), then \(bRa\) c) If \(aRb\), then \(bRa\) d) If \(aRc\), then \(bRc\)
Which of the following is not a property of an equivalence relation? a) Reflexivity b) Symmetry c) Transitivity d) Anti-symmetry
In a Boolean algebra, the complement of an element \(a\) is defined as: a) \(a \lor 1\) b) \(a \land 0\) c) \(\neg a\) d) \(a \rightarrow a\)
The number of vertices in a binary tree of height \(h\) is at most: a) \(2^h - 1\) b) \(2^{h+1} - 1\) c) \(2^{h-1}\) d) \(2h - 1\)
A spanning tree of a connected graph with \(n\) vertices and \(m\) edges has: a) \(n-1\) edges b) \(m-1\) edges c) \(n-m\) edges d) \(m-n\) edges

The number of permutations of the set \(\{1, 2, 3, 4\}\) is: a) 12 b) 16 c) 24 d) 32
In a directed acyclic graph (DAG), which of the following is true? a) It has at least one cycle b) It has a topological ordering c) Every vertex has a self-loop d) It is strongly connected
The Big-O notation for the time complexity of the binary search algorithm is: a) \(O(n)\) b) \(O(\log n)\) c) \(O(n^2)\) d) \(O(1)\)
In a group \(G\), the inverse of an element \(a\) is denoted by: a) \(a^2\) b) \(a^{-1}\) c) \(\neg a\) d) \(a'\)
